content.raw: As Martin pointed out, you can perfectly use a catkin workspace to develop your solution code; while it interacts with the SubT Simulator Testbed Docker image inside a contained \(as shown [here](#!/osrf/subt/wiki/tutorials/CustomControl)\).  Once you are done developing and testing your solution code, then you will create a Docker image for it \(e.g. `subt_seed`\) to either test it locally with Docker-Compose \(optional, but recommended\), or in [Cloudsim](https://www.subtchallenge.world/home).
content.html: As Martin pointed out, you can perfectly use a catkin workspace to develop your solution code; while it interacts with the SubT Simulator Testbed Docker image inside a contained (as shown here). Once you are done developing and testing your solution code, then you will create a Docker image for it (e.g. subt_seed) to either test it locally with Docker-Compose (optional, but recommended), or in Cloudsim.
